page.title: 07Railway Transport
page.content: The main railway line from Bristol to Weston-super-Mare passes through the area. This is the main line that serves the West Country reaching as far as Penzance. Originally it was the Bristol and Exeter Railway which was opened in 1841. It later became part of the Great Western Railway. There are also the lines of two dismantled railways in the area which had a junction at Congresbury. One was the Cheddar Valley line which was famous for carrying strawberries. The other was the Wrington Vale Light Railway. Today the main line takes Inter-City 125 trains. During one school day 13 trains passed in the direction of Bristol of which 11 where passenger trains. Towards Weston the number was 17 trains and all were passenger.
